intro: Uraspermum dulce var. laevicaule, commonly known as sweet uraspermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, cylindrical stems and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a velvety texture. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
